# OPEC+ set to keep oil production pause for March as prices jump, sources say

By Ahmad Ghaddar, Olesya Astakhova and Alex Lawler

Fri, January 30, 2026 at 2:29 AM PST2 min read

[CL=F \\
+0.49%](https://finance.yahoo.com/quote/CL%3DF/ "CL=F")

By Ahmad Ghaddar, Olesya Astakhova and Alex Lawler

LONDON, Jan 30 - OPEC+ is likely to keep its pause on oil output increases for March when ​it meets on Sunday, five delegates told Reuters, even as crude climbs ‌above $70 a barrel on concern the U.S. could launch a military strike on OPEC member Iran.

The meeting of ‌eight OPEC+ members, which pump about half the world's oil, comes as Brent crude has risen to almost $72 a barrel, its highest since August, despite speculation that a supply glut would push prices down.
